results.title: Breakfast in Paris
results.brief_description: A high-powered female fashion executive meets a handsome, carefree photographer and their relationship starts with hot glares and cold shoulders. Things don’t get much better for him until the romance of Paris catches up with her. Filmed on location in Paris. Stars Barbara Parkins, Rod Mullinar and Jack Lenoir.

results.title: Sky Pirates
results.creator_credit: Colin Eggleston, Michael Hirsh, John Lamond and John Lamond Motion Pictures Production
results.brief_description: Set during World War II, this film is about a plane crashing into the Pacific Ocean and the survivors finding themselves in a time warp. Stars John Hargreaves, Meredith Phillips and Max Phipps.

results.title: Fortress
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Raymond Menmuir and Crawford Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Gabrielle Lord. A teacher and her class of nine students are kidnapped by four masked men and held for ransom. The victims plot to escape by outwitting their captors.

results.title: Fatty Finn
results.creator_credit: Maurice Murphy, Brian Rosen, Finn Films, Australian Film Commission and Children's Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Film version of Australia’s comic strip, set in the years of the depression. Fatty is head of the neighbourhood nice guys and has a final confrontation with Bruiser Murphy and his gang of toughs. Stars Noni Hazlehurst and Bert Newton.

results.title: Boundaries of the heart
results.creator_credit: Patric Juillet, Tra La La Films, FGH Film Consortium and Lex Marinos
results.brief_description: Depicts life in an outback Australian town, centring on a small town belle who has become bitter and stilted. She is alienating her family friends and shearer boyfriend and after many humiliations, she faces a bleak and lonely future. Stars Wendy Hughes, John Hargreaves and Norman Kaye.

results.title: Archer
results.creator_credit: Maya Iceton, Roadshow Television, Coote and Carroll and Denny Lawrence
results.brief_description: Brett Climo plays Dave Power, a young and ambitious caretaker of a racehorse named Archer. In order to get Archer to the 1861 Melbourne Cup, where the horse must compete. Power takes him on a 600-mile outback odyssey, fraught with excitment and peril. The horse then wins the race. Also features 18 year old Nicole Kidman in a crucial role Based on a true story of perhaps Australia’s greatest racehorse

results.title: Emoh ruo
results.creator_credit: Denny Lawrence, David Elfick, Palm Beach Pictures and UAA Films
results.brief_description: Australian satire about the Tunkley family and the trouble they encounter when they buy their first home. Stars Joy Smithers and Martin Sacks.

results.title: Rikky and Pete = Rikky & Pete
results.creator_credit: Nadia Tass, David Parker and Cascade Films
results.brief_description: Rikky is a talented and would be singer and her brother, Pete, is a mechanical genius. After Pete pulls one practical joke too many, they escape Melbourne for an adventure in the outback eventually finding themselves amongst the characters of a mining town. Stars Stephen Kearney and Nina Landis with Bill Hunter, Bruno Lawrence and Bruce Spence in supporting roles.

results.title: The Return of Captain Invincible
results.creator_credit: Philippe Mora, Willarra and Seven Keys
results.brief_description: Captain Invincible was once the world’s greatest super-hero before he was falsely accused of treason and dishonourably discharged from active service 30 years ago. The United States President calls on his childhood hero, now aging and an alcoholic, to save the world from the evil Mr Midnight. Stars Alan Arkin, Christopher Lee with Kate Fitzpatrick, Bill Hunter and Graham Kennedy.

results.title: Roadgames = Road games (D)
results.brief_description: A psychopathic killer is haunting the Nullarbor Highway in search of female hitch-hikers whom he picks up, rapes, kills and dismembers. An eccentric, long-haul truck driver determines to track down the murderer and is helped by a young hitch-hiker he picks up. Stars Stacy Keach and Jamie Lee Curtis.
